newsitem.title: USA: CME cattle and pork complex pre-opening calls.
newsitem.headline: CME cattle and pork complex pre-opening calls.

text.p: CME cattle and pork complex pre-opening calls as of 0805 CDT.

LIVE CATTLE - steady to 0.10 cent lower - Market could fall further in the short term as it experiences a technical downside correction after last week's run-up to contract highs. Cash trade remains at a standstill but could develop soon around $64 per cwt, steady with last week's trade.
FEEDER CATTLE - 0.10 to 0.15 cent lower - Modest overnight gains in CBOT corn may weigh on the market early. Latest CME feeder cattle index, for July 21, was down $0.10 per cwt at $82.04.
LEAN HOGS - 0.20 to 0.25 cent lower - Weaker product prices weighing on the market. Cash hogs also look set to be around $0.50 per cwt lower Wednesday.

PORK BELLIES - steady to 0.25 cent lower - Cash fresh belly market weakened Tuesday but pork belly futures held up well given the sharp setback in CME hogs. CME weekly out-of-town pork belly storage report showed net out-movement of 2.91 million lbs, in line with most forecasts.
